intro: [WRONG START] Illcecebrum truxillense, commonly known as the Trinidad nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Trinidad. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or white in color. Its fruit is a small, green berry that turns red when ripe. Illecebrum truxillense is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is considered a minor weed in certain regions.
